    Base Classes

    The flowerpower-io library provides several base classes that form the foundation for all I/O operations. These classes handle common functionality for file and database operations, including data conversion, filtering, and metadata management.

    BaseFileIO

    class BaseFileIO(msgspec.Struct, gc=False)

    The base class for file I/O operations supporting various storage backends.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot).

    Properties

    Property Type Description
    protocol str Get the protocol of the filesystem.
    _base_path str Get the base path for the filesystem.
    _path str \| list[str] Get the processed path.
    _glob_path str \| list[str] Get the glob path for file operations.
    _root_path str Get the root path for the filesystem.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    list_files () -> list[str] List files matching the path pattern.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseFileIO

# Initialize with local path
file_io = BaseFileIO(path="data/")

# Initialize with S3 path
file_io = BaseFileIO(
    path="s3://bucket/path/to/files",
    storage_options=AwsStorageOptions(
        key="access_key",
        secret="secret_key"
    )
)

# List files
files = file_io.list_files()

    BaseFileReader

    class BaseFileReader(BaseFileIO, gc=False)

    The base class for file loading operations supporting various file formats.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    include_file_path bool Include file path in the output DataFrame. Default: False
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: True
    batch_size int \| None Batch size for reading data. Default: None
    opt_dtypes bool Optimize data types. Default: False
    use_threads bool Use threads for reading data. Default: True
    conn duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None DuckDB connection instance.
    ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None DataFusion session context instance.
    jsonlines bool \| None Whether the file is in JSON Lines format.
    partitioning str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    verbose bool \| None Verbose output.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pandas (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame \| list[pd.DataFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame(s).
    iter_pandas (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pd.DataFrame, None, None] Iterate over Pandas DataFrames.
    to_polars (lazy: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| tuple[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame or LazyFrame.
    iter_polars (lazy: bool = False, reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame, None, None] Iterate over Polars DataFrames or LazyFrames.
    to_pyarrow_table (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| list[pa.Table] \| tuple[pa.Table \| list[pa.Table], dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table(s).
    iter_pyarrow_table (reload: bool = False, batch_size: int \| None = None, include_file_path: bool = False, concat: bool \| None = None, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[pa.Table, None, None] Iterate over PyArrow Tables.
    to_duckdb_relation (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DuckDB.
    to_duckdb (as_relation: bool = True, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation or register in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (ctx: datafusion.SessionContext, name: str \| None = None, metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, include_file_path: bool = False, use_threads: bool \| None = None, verbose: bool \| None = None, opt_dtypes: bool \| None = None, **kwargs) -> datafusion.SessionContext \| tuple[datafusion.SessionContext, dict[str, Any]] Register data in DataFusion.
    filter (filter_expr: str \| pl.Expr \| pa.compute.Expression) -> pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| list[pl.DataFrame] \| list[pl.LazyFrame] \| list[pa.Table] Filter data based on a filter expression.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseFileReader

# Initialize file reader
reader = BaseFileReader(
    path="data/*.csv",
    format="csv",
    include_file_path=True,
    concat=True
)

# Convert to different formats
df_pandas = reader.to_pandas()
df_polars = reader.to_polars()
table_arrow = reader.to_pyarrow_table()

# Register in DuckDB
conn = reader.register_in_duckdb(name="my_table")

# Filter data
filtered = reader.filter("column > 100")

    BaseDatasetReader

    class BaseDatasetReader(BaseFileReader, gc=False)

    The base class for dataset loading operations supporting various file formats.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    _dataset pds.Dataset \| None Internal PyArrow dataset.
    _pydala_dataset Any \| None Internal Pydala dataset.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_pyarrow_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pds.Dataset \| tuple[pds.Dataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Dataset.
    to_pydala_dataset (metadata: bool = False, reload: bool = False, **kwargs) -> ParquetDataset \| tuple[ParquetDataset, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pydala ParquetDataset.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseDatasetReader

# Initialize dataset reader
reader = BaseDatasetReader(
    path="dataset/",
    format="parquet",
    schema_=pa.schema([
        pa.field("id", pa.int64()),
        pa.field("name", pa.string())
    ])
)

# Convert to dataset
dataset = reader.to_pyarrow_dataset()

    BaseFileWriter

    class BaseFileWriter(BaseFileIO, gc=False)

    The base class for file writing operations supporting various storage backends.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], basename: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to file.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseFileWriter

# Initialize file writer
writer = BaseFileWriter(
    path="output/",
    format="parquet",
    basename="result",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = writer.write(df)

    BaseDatasetWriter

    class BaseDatasetWriter(BaseFileWriter, gc=False)

    The base class for dataset writing operations supporting various file formats.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    partition_by str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    partitioning_flavor str \| None Partitioning flavor for the dataset.
    compression str Compression codec for the dataset. Default: "zstd"
    row_group_size int \| None Row group size for the dataset. Default: 250000
    max_rows_per_file int \| None Maximum number of rows per file. Default: 2500000
    is_pydala_dataset bool Write data as a Pydala ParquetDataset. Default: False

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, delta_subset: str \| None = None, alter_schema: bool = False, update_metadata: bool = True, timestamp_column: str \| None = None, verbose: bool = False, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to dataset.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseDatasetWriter

# Initialize dataset writer
writer = BaseDatasetWriter(
    path="output_dataset/",
    format="parquet",
    partition_by="category",
    compression="zstd"
)

# Write data with partitioning
metadata = writer.write(df)

    BaseDatabaseIO

    class BaseDatabaseIO(msgspec.Struct, gc=False)

    The base class for database read/write operations supporting various database systems.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type (sqlite, duckdb, postgres, mysql, mssql, oracle).
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite or DuckDB databases.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    execute (query: str, cursor: bool = True, **query_kwargs) Execute a SQL query.
    create_engine () -> sqlalchemy.engine.Engine Create a SQLAlchemy engine.
    connect () -> sqlite3.Connection \| duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| sqlalchemy.engine.Connection Create a database connection.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseDatabaseIO

# Initialize database IO
db_io = BaseDatabaseIO(
    type_="sqlite",
    table_name="my_table",
    path="database.db"
)

# Execute query
result = db_io.execute("SELECT * FROM my_table")

    BaseDatabaseReader

    class BaseDatabaseReader(BaseDatabaseIO, gc=False)

    The base class for database read operations supporting various database systems.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    query str \| None SQL query to execute.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    to_polars (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pl.DataFrame \| tuple[pl.DataFrame, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Polars DataFrame.
    to_pandas (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pd.DataFrame \| tuple[pd.DataFrame, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to Pandas DataFrame.
    to_pyarrow_table (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, **kwargs) -> pa.Table \| tuple[pa.Table, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to PyArrow Table.
    to_duckdb_relation (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, metadata: bool = False, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, **kwargs) -> duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation \| tuple[duckdb.DuckDBPyRelation, dict[str, Any]] Convert data to DuckDB relation.
    register_in_duckdb (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, conn: duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DuckDB.
    register_in_datafusion (query: str \| None = None, reload: bool = False, ctx: datafusion.SessionContext \| None = None, name: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> None Register data in DataFusion.
    metadata property Get metadata for the loaded data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io import BaseDatabaseReader

# Initialize database reader
reader = BaseDatabaseReader(
    type_="postgres",
    table_name="users",
    host="localhost",
    username="user",
    password="password",
    database="mydb"
)

# Query data
df = reader.to_polars("SELECT * FROM users WHERE active = true")

    BaseDatabaseWriter

    class BaseDatabaseWriter(BaseDatabaseIO, gc=False)

    The base class for database writing operations supporting various database systems.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    ```python from flowerpower_io import BaseDatabaseWriter

    Initialize database writer

    writer = BaseDatabaseWriter( type_="mysql", table_name="logs", host="localhost", username="user", password="password", database="appdb", mode="append" )

    Write data

    metadata = writer.write(df)
